children.text: There is a pipe that has a horizontal offset within the depth of the slab, which will become encased in concrete and not allow for the expected differential surface movement of the ‘P’ class site, which may lead to the pipe cracking and leaking underneath the slab.

The relevant Australian Standard AS 2870 Residential Slabs and Footings only allows for straight vertical pipes to run through a slab, not offset ones, and requires any such penetration to be detailed to allow for this expected movement. However, it does not provide guidance on how to lag or treat such a penetration on a P class site.
The offset within this pipe should therefore be lowered down beneath the slab so that only a vertical pipe runs through the depth of it.
